meanings.definition: The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seeds and can be eaten as food.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat fresh fruit every morning for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She picked an apple from the tree, a delicious fruit.
meanings.sent3: The fruit salad was a colorful mix of various fruits.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of fruity joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fruit juice dripped down his chin as he took a big bite.

meanings.definition: The result or reward of work or activity.
meanings.sent1: His hard work finally bore fruit when he received a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's dedication to training paid off, and victory was the sweetest fruit.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunt ended with the discovery of a chest full of gold coins, the fruit of their adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her patience in teaching her child to read yielded fruit when he read his first book aloud.
meanings.sent5: The successful completion of the project was the fruit of their teamwork and collaboration.

meanings.definition: To produce fruit, as a plant or tree.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree will fruit in the fall, providing us with fresh apples.
meanings.sent2: After planting the seeds, the garden began to fruit with colorful blooms.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to fruit with endless scarves as he performed his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts to improve her skills started to fruit when she won her first competition.
meanings.sent5: The hard work of the farmers will fruit in a bountiful harvest this season.
